CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "Jackie Robinson - Bats for Brotherhood - Jackie Robinson, 1954 chairman of the Commission on Community Organizations of the National Conference of Christians and Jews, is undertaking a nation-wide tour building interest in Brotherhood Week, to be celebrated Feb. 21-28. He was in Pittsburgh Monday.  Other stops include Detroit, South Bend, St. Louis, Tulsa and Los Angeles.  Louis A. Radelat, director of the commission, accompanied Jackie. Our Hero - Youngsters at IKS, above and below, listened with rapt attention as Jackie outlined the bright future which awaits those who are prepared.  He summed up the post-war change in attitude by citing that in 1946, the Jacksonville, Fla. ballpark was padlocked to prevent Jackie's playing; last year the most valuable player in Florida State League was a Negro member of the same Jacksonville club."
TitMainTitle: Group of boys and young men, including George "Dice" Brown, gathered around Jackie Robinson at Irene Kaufmann Settlement House
